Key Match Events: N'Golo Kante and Marcus Thuram had efforts denied by fine saves from goalkeeper Maxime Crepeau
Kylian Mbappé came close to score in the last play of the match, but Crepeau prevented him from making it 1-0
Pre-Game Insights: France, who comfortably beat Luxembourg 3-0 on Wednesday, are among the favourites to win the European title
France face Austria in their tournament opener before taking on the Netherlands on June 21 and Poland four days later
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Didier Deschamps said 'We were up against some good opposition with a lot of intensity, and we had a few good chances in the first half. After that it was more difficult'

Didier Deschamps added 'It's not ideal but it was important for me to spread the play around and get everyone involved in these two friendly games. It wasn't easy today, and we're going to make the most of it in terms of what awaits us on June 17'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Olivier Giroud received a standing ovation at the Nouveau Stade de Bordeaux as it was his last appearance on home soil
France forward Kylian Mbappé came off the bench in the 74th minute
Others: The match was played at the Nouveau Stade de Bordeaux with an attendance of 40,835
The referee for the match was Fabio Verissimo
